summary: The Ecosystem Architecture series explores the evolution of ecosystems from biological contexts, limited by space and time, to modern, dispersed, human organizations. The rise of the internet has spurred this transition, necessitating a multidisciplinary design approach termed 'ecosystem architecture' to create thriving, intentional, non-natural ecosystems
excerpt: Ecosystems once limited by geography now describe dynamic, dispersed human organizations. This shift, fueled by the internet, calls for 'ecosystem architecture,' a multidisciplinary design approach
